title: Warzone performance decimated on PC with Season 1 update
text:
You can trust VideoGamer . Our team of gaming experts spend hours testing and reviewing the latest games, to ensure you're reading the most comprehensive guide possible. Rest assured, all imagery and advice is unique and original. Check out how we test and review games here
Contents hide Warzone on Steam is the worst way to play Will it get fixed? Ensuring your copy of the latest Call of Duty game runs without issue is key to avoid any kind of unwanted stuttering during the heat of battle. In Warzone, the arrival of the innovative Omnimovement system means your reaction times are more important than ever when it comes to outplaying the opposition.
While the Season 1 update introduced a wealth of content, including the meta-shifting Krig C assault rifle, the latest update has massively affected players on Steam. For some reason, this version of the game’s PC port has been ravaged by awful performance, making it the worst place to load into the action.
Warzone on Steam is the worst way to play Battle royale fans dropping into Urzikstan, Area 99, and Rebirth Island using Valve’s platform have noticed their frame rate is significantly worse than those playing matches on Nattle.net and the Xbox PC app much to their annoyance.
Frame rate often determines how smooth your game looks. The higher the number, the smoother it is. Steam users are reporting they’re struggling to reach 80 frames per second while those on other platforms are managing to reach anywhere between 100 and 200, potentially giving them a significant advantage on their quests to become the last one standing in the final circle.
Players have noticed that the performance of Call of Duty: Warzone on Steam is worse than that of Battle net and Xbox PC app after Season 01 launch.
Many are reporting that Bnet and Xbox app is giving 100-200FPS+ compared to the Steam version, with some seeing <80FPS on Steam. pic.twitter.com/kCiQrrqwTF
— CharlieIntel (@charlieINTEL) November 21, 2024 Many cite the launch of the first seasonal update as the root cause of the lower Steam frame rates. Another theory that could cause a significant drop in performance is Valve adding a recording feature to the platform. While running alongside other capture software such as NVIDIA Instant Replay, it could result in huge frame drops when compared to Blizzard’s and Microsoft’s dedicated platforms.
Will it get fixed? The Black Ops 6 integration into Warzone hasn’t gone well. Rebirth Island was removed just hours after launch due to “map-specific” issues while Raven Software has already had to apply movement changes to enhance the battle royale’s fluidity. Despite the flaws, it’s hugely positive to see the developer being proactive to rectify any problems.
Steam’s sluggish frame rate is another addition to the ever-growing list. Considering the speed Raven Software is working at to address the game-breaking glitches, there’s a possibility Warzone will be optimised further in a future update. If not, make sure any capture software isn’t hogging any hardware power while on the battlefield.
Before you attempt to score that next win, take a look at when the next double XP weekend is taking place within battle royale, Resurgence, and Plunder modes.
About the Author Jon Nicholson
Jon is a Freelance Writer for VideoGamer. When he's not obsessing over Call of Duty and Warzone, you can find him on the virtual racetrack sim racing.

title: Storm Gerrit causes travel problems and power cuts across Dumfries and Galloway
text:
A driver had to be rescued from a submerged car as Storm Gerrit battered Dumfries and Galloway on Wednesday.
The drama unfolded on the old military road from Lochfoot to Dumfries.
Power was cut to dozens of homes as the storm raged.
And transport was hit badly with flooding and falling trees blocking roads, while train services were disrupted. Dozens of homes were affected by power cuts and persistent heavy rain which also caused some localised flooding across the region, including the Whitesands in Dumfries.
Dumfries and Galloway Council took the step of posting a Virtual Operations Support Team (VOST) warning list of live incidents on roads and of flooding to keep the public informed.
Trains were cancelled on Wednesday from Glasgow to Dumfries and yesterday there were no early services from Kilmarnock to Dumfries.
Brooms Road in Dumfries was badly flooded
A message posted on Facebook on Wednesday told how the Boathouse cafe and restaurant at Glencaple near Dumfries would be shut due to flooded access roads.
And another social media post on Wednesday told how a driver had to be rescued on the old military road.
Meanwhile, police said yesterday that cars were trapped on Glencaple Road due to warning signs being ignored.
The Bankend Road
The Met Office said that 20 to 45mm of rain was expected in 24 hours until yesterday in Scotland along with winds reaching 60 to 70mph in some areas.
And according to meteorologist Geoff Monk of Laurieston, the storm was much more remarkable for rain amounts than wind speeds.
Speaking at 1pm on Wednesday, he said: “From 2am this morning we have had 50mm – it was absolutely throwing it down. And west of Glasgow they had 35mm in six hours.
“It’s a really wet system but it is pushing north quite quickly. We have had the worst but that’s not to say it’s finished.”

author: @todonoticias
title: Susto en Palermo: una nena de tres años sufrió convulsiones en plena calle y fue salvada gracias a un "Punto Seguro" | TN
text:
Una nena de tres años sufrió convulsiones mientras caminaba con su mamá en una calle de Palermo y fue salvada gracias a la rápida activación de un “Punto Seguro” , el sistema de seguridad que permite comunicarse directamente con el 911.
El dramático episodio ocurrió en la esquina de Sarmiento y Casares, donde la madre pulsó el botón del tótem para contactarse con el servicio de emergencia. En cuestión de segundos, la Policía de la Ciudad recibió la alerta y llevó a cabo un operativo que permitió salvarle la vida.
Leé también: “¡Dejame bajar a la nena!”: el desesperado pedido de un hombre mientras le robaban el auto en Lomas de Zamora
Según describió la mujer a través de la comunicación, la menor no respondía a estímulos y tenía serias dificultades para respirar . Fue así como efectivos de la Comisaría Comunal 14C llegaron al lugar en tiempo récord: participaron móviles, motos y un cuatriciclo, que implementaron un cordón sanitario para trasladarla de urgencia al Hospital Fernández .
En el centro de salud, la nena fue estabilizada y se le diagnosticó síndrome convulsivo . En estos momentos, permanece en observación y está fuera de peligro .
La madre de la nena de tres años se contactó con el 911 a través de un "Punto Seguro". (Foto: captura de video) La ciudad de Buenos Aires ya cuenta con más de 300 Puntos Seguros instalados en zonas estratégicas para reforzar la seguridad en el espacio público . Estos tótems cuentan con sirena, cámara, baliza, intercomunicador antivandálico y están conectados directamente con el 911 . Además de asistir en casos policiales, permiten dar aviso en emergencias médicas, accidentes , incendios o situaciones de violencia de género.
“ En una emergencia, cada segundo cuenta . Que el 911 responda en menos de 5 segundos, y que un móvil y un cuatriciclo hayan llegado en menos de 5 minutos, hoy nos permiten ver el éxito de un trabajo coordinado”, expresó el Jefe de Gobierno porteño, J orge Macri , tras conocerse el caso.
Leé también: Sufrió un violento robo cuando estaba embarazada y su bebé nació con trastornos por el estrés
“ Los tótems de seguridad son una herramienta adicional a la presencia de la policía , las cámaras, el patrullaje y el vecino que avisa al 911. Seguimos incorporando tecnología para darle más seguridad a los porteños y a la gente que viene todos los días a la Ciudad”, agregó Macri, quien visitó la División 911 junto al ministro de Seguridad, Horacio Giménez.

author: Arrigo Schieppati
title: La proteinuria può essere segno di tumore
text: 15 novembre 24Buongiorno dottore Fatta un proteinuria delle 24 h ore dove si riscontrato proteine a 2.165mg su volume di urine 1350 ml Creatinina azotemia perfetta sodio e potassio delle 24h nelle urine buona proteine totali 5,1 albumina 54 Tiroide buona glicemia perfetta ....indici di infiammazione perfetti Nessun sintomo a parte schiuma nelle urine no edema nulla e neanche sintomi di altro genere solo un po di dolore articolare Ecografia renale e addominale perfetta Il medico ha consigliato tutti i markers tumorali e tac torace e addominale secondo lei questa sintomatologia è segno di tumore ??? in Rene In generale preferisco non mettere in discussione - in questo spazio in cui la possibilità di conoscere la reale condizione di chi ci scrive è molto limitata - le indicazioni diagnostiche e terapeutiche di colleghi che hanno avuto l'opportunità di valutare un paziente con una visita e con un esame della documentazione clinica. Per cui non posso commentare l'indicazione del suo curante. Posso dirle in risposta alla sua domanda, che esistono alcune forme di malattia renale proteinurica che si possono associare a neoplasie. In generale è necessario stabilire prima quale sia il tipo di nefropatia che affligge il paziente, per esempio con una biopsia renale (se non vi sono controindicazioni assolute a questo esame), e successivamente in base all'esito dell'esame istologico decidere quale percorso diagnostico seguire, se la forma di malattia renale è una di quelle che si associano al rischio di neoplasia.

author: UK News
title: Drivers warned of delays during M25 closure as UK could see hottest day of year - Jersey Evening Post
text:
Motorists have been warned of lengthy delays as parts of the M25 close over the weekend, which could see the hottest day of the year so far.
The motorway – which is Britain’s busiest – will be closed in both directions between junctions 9 and 10 in Surrey from 9pm on Friday until 6am on Monday while concrete beams for a new bridge are installed.
Saturday is predicted to see temperatures rise as high as 26C in parts of south-east England, including around London, in what would be the hottest day of the year.
We are installing a new bridge this coming weekend, so we will be closing the M25 both ways between junctions 9 and 10 from 9pm Friday 10 May to 6am Monday 13 May. Only travel if necessary.
More info:
▶️ https://t.co/YiY0SVelYb pic.twitter.com/7oqxWKauUw
— National Highways (@NationalHways) May 7, 2024
Diversion routes will take cars on a 19-mile journey on A roads, crossing from Surrey into London’s Ulez area, though National Highways has assured drivers “no enforcement action will be taken”.
But the highways authority said anyone who ignores official diversion signs in an attempt to find shorter alternative routes will be liable for the £12.50 daily Ulez fee if their vehicle does not meet minimum emissions standards.
Failure to pay the charge when required can result in a £180 fine, reduced to £90 if paid within 14 days.
The RAC advised motorists to avoid travelling if possible and pack extra food and drink if they do, as the closures are likely to bring long delays for thousands of drivers.
Alice Simpson, RAC breakdown spokesperson, said: “As this next M25 weekend closure immediately follows major national rail strikes which could see many more people take to the roads, it could be up to six days of disrupted travel for London’s drivers.
“With weekend temperatures reaching 25 degrees or even higher, it’s likely that routes around the 23-mile diversion will be busy as people make the most of the fine weather and jump in the car for day trips.
“Anyone heading to Chessington World of Adventures, which is close to the official A3 diversion route, should expect delays and pack extra food and drink in the event they’re on the road longer than expected.
“Holidaymakers heading to Gatwick or Heathrow should leave an hour earlier than usual and allow plenty of time for parking and security checks.”
The M25 closure is the second of five planned weekend closures which come as part of a £317 million project to improve Junction 10.

author: 記者楊博喻／綜合報導
title: 氣候潮濕「霉味」揮之不去超惱人　管線異味瀰漫網分享除臭撇步
text:
氣候潮濕「霉味」揮之不去超惱人 管線異味瀰漫網分享除臭撇步
記者楊博喻／綜合報導
你是否也有這種經驗？房間看起來乾淨，卻總有一股說不出的怪味揮之不去。其實，許多室內異味都藏在日常忽略的細節中，且長期暴露在異味中不只影響生活品質，甚至可能對健康造成影響。想找出臭味從哪來、改善居家空氣品質，不妨從這幾個常見的異味來源開始檢查！
《Social Lab社群實驗室》本次透過《OpView社群口碑資料庫》追蹤三個月內「室內異味來源」相關話題的網路聲量，帶您了解網友熱議的居家臭味元凶。
氣候潮濕 「霉味」揮之不去超惱人 管線異味瀰漫網分享除臭撇步
觀察近三個月內網友針對「室內異味來源」的相關話題討論，發現「室內潮濕霉味」讓許多人難以忍受。台灣夏季氣候潮濕悶熱、各地相對濕度高，讓不少民眾困擾不已，如一位網友就苦惱表示「最近租屋處漏水整間霉味超重」，讓他「鼻子過敏到爆」；也有民眾在論壇請益「套房曬衣服怎麼防潮濕跟霉味？」，提到自己已固定開窗通風但效果仍不彰，因此十分傷腦筋。對此，不少人分享自身經驗與解方，表示「除濕機才是王道」，搭配電風扇能加快衣物乾燥；也有人建議「定期清潔易發霉處，如浴室、廚房」，並使用小蘇打粉、漂白水等天然清潔劑抑制霉菌滋生。
此外，「排水孔或管線異味」也是討論度頗高的異味問題。社群論壇中常見網友發文提及「浴室排水孔清好幾次還是飄整間房，快被薰死」、「廚房排水管道偶爾一陣一陣飄出臭味」等等，甚至有住在老公寓的網友抱怨「馬桶沖水後整間都是異味，怎麼清都沒用」；對於這類情形，有不少網友給出實用「小撇步」，像是「每週倒漂白水」、「加入小蘇打加醋或溫水」，或者「過碳酸鈉也有用」。不過，也有住在社區大樓反映因下水道是「共管系統」，「別人家沒清也會飄味道過來」，此時可能就需要向管委會或物業管理公司求助，請他們安排對整體排水系統的檢查和保養。
從「冷氣機」飄出的臭味也讓不少人頭痛。隨著天氣逐漸轉熱，不少人一開冷氣就聞到「臭酸味或悶霉味」，不禁懷疑是否機器出了問題，紛紛抱怨「冷氣剛洗完，但只要溫度不夠低就有霉味」、「開到25度以上味道更明顯」。針對這類情況，有內行網友建議「關機前切送風模式一小時」、「關冷氣後不要馬上關房門，讓機器透氣」，否則容易因殘留水氣產生霉味，「就像衣服沒曬乾的潮濕味」。也有冷氣師傅提醒，定期清潔濾網與冷排，不僅能消除異味，還能提升效能與空氣品質，「清完之後冷得快又沒臭味，空氣也清新多了」。
除了上述提到的異味來源，「寵物體味」、「菸味」以及「廚餘酸臭」也是不少網友點名的室內臭氣元凶。想徹底擺脫惱人氣味，除了定期清潔與保持通風，也可視情況加強除濕、防霉與管線保養，讓異味不再成為生活中的負擔！
